intro: Astracantha adscendens, commonly known as the ascending astracantha, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, featuring woody stems and dense, spiny foliage. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange, arranged in clusters, and bloom during the warmer months. Astracantha adscendens is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
